summary: This document is a chronological log of psychological observations and suicide risk assessments for Jeffrey Epstein while he was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July-August 2019. It details his mental state, complaints about confinement, interactions with staff and his cellmate, and the incident on July 23 where he was found with a string around his neck. The log concludes with his death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the psychological observation log. He is assessed for suicide risk, makes numerous complaints about confinement, and denies suicidality while discussing his legal case and future plans.

persons.name: Dr. M
persons.context: The primary clinician conducting suicide risk assessments and psychological observations of Jeffrey Epstein. Documents Epstein's statements, mental status, and interactions.

persons.name: Epstein's Cellmate
persons.context: An unnamed inmate who shared a cell with Epstein in the SHU. Epstein reported the cellmate was agitated, called him a pedophile, and Epstein later expressed fear of him after the July 23 incident.

persons.name: Epstein's Attorney (Palm Beach)
persons.context: Present during a conference on July 11, 2019, when Epstein mocked Dr. M about being placed on suicide watch.

connections.description: Dr. M conducted regular psychological evaluations and suicide risk assessments on Epstein while he was in custody.
Shared a cell in the SHU. Epstein reported conflicts, including the cellmate calling him a pedophile and Epstein later fearing the cellmate tried to kill him.
Epstein was meeting with his attorney for legal visits, and the attorney was present during at least one psychological observation session.

events.title: Epstein Arrives in General Population
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and is placed in General Population (GP).

events.title: Initial Intake and Placement on Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein undergoes intake screening with no significant mental health history noted. Later, Dr. M consults with Central Office and Epstein is placed on psychological observation as a precaution.

events.title: String Incident and Placement on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein is placed on Suicide Watch (SW) after a string is found loosely hanging from around his neck. He claims not to remember the event and suggests his cellmate may have been involved.

events.title: Court Inquiry on Suicidal Tendencies
events.description: The court sends a form regarding 'suicidal tendencies.' Dr. M conducts a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) where Epstein again denies suicidality.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found unresponsive and hanging in his SHU cell at 6:30 a.m., ten days after removal from constant observation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on psychological observation and later suicide watch as a precaution, despite consistently denying any history or current thoughts of suicide.
On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found with a string loosely around his neck. He claimed no memory of the event and suggested his cellmate, who had called him a pedophile, might have been responsible.
Epstein repeatedly expressed a desire to live to fight his legal case, cited his Jewish faith as a reason against suicide, and discussed future-oriented plans.
The log documents numerous complaints from Epstein about prison conditions, including noise in the SHU, lack of phone calls, recreation, and specific medications.
Epstein was found dead in his SHU cell on August 10, 2019, approximately ten days after being removed from constant psychological observation status.
